intro: Pimpinella tragium var. olenea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are finely divided and often have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and woodland edges. This plant is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, where it can sometimes become invasive.
